intro: Tribulus omanense, commonly known as the Oman spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately lobed, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. Tribulus omanense is often found in sandy soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine in the region.
